panels.content:
### On the map at left:

 - Black hatched circles indicate areas where satellite data is extracted.
 
 - Red dots indicate National Estuarine Research Reserves (NERR) locations where water quality is measured

 - Green dots indicate locations where river gauge height is measured by the USGS.

 - Red rectangle indicates the Gray's Reef National Marine Sanctuary boundary. 
 
 - The black dot inside the sanctuary boundary indicates the location of a meteorological buoy where winds are measured.

### Directions for site navigation: 

To look at satellite time series, select location(s) using the the location number in the "Satellite Time Series Extraction Locations" dropdown menu at left.

Select mean, climatology or anomaly using the "Time Series Metric" dropdown menu.

Gauge height from the USGS is available from five locations (green dots on the map). Select river(s) to display using the "USGS River Gauge Location" dropdown menu.

The range of the displayed time period can be adjusted at top right.

Scroll down to see all of the images and time series.
panels.title: Welcome to the Gray's Reef NMS data dashboard

panels.description:
MODIS-Aqua 1km chlor_a product (mg/m^3) binned to 7-day intervals.
Anomaly images created by subtracting 7-day climatologies made using data from 2003-2019.
panels.title: MODIS-Aqua CHLa 7-Day anomaly images (mg/m^3)
MODIS-Aqua remote sensing reflectance at 667nm 7-Day anomaly images (sr^-1)

targets.query:
SELECT mean(/^$metric$/) as metric FROM "moda_chlor_a"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT mean(/^$metric$/) AS anomaly FROM "moda_sst4"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT mean(/^$metric$/) AS anomaly FROM "moda_Rrs_667"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT mean(/^$metric$/) AS anomaly FROM "moda_ABI"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

panels.content:
#### Station 41008 is a 3-m discuss buoy located within Gray's Reef National Marine Sanctuary (31.4N/80.866W). Water depth at this location is 16m.

#### Meterological parameters:
1. Wind speed (m/s) averaged over an eight-minute period 3.8m above sea level.
2. Wind direction (the direction the wind is coming from in degrees clockwise from true N) over an 8-minute period 3.8m above sea level. 
3. Peak 5 second gust speed (m/s) measured during the eight-minute or two-minute period 3.8m above sea level. 
4. Significant wave height (m) is the average of the highest one-third of all of the wave heights during the 20-minute sampling period.
5. Dominant wave period (seconds) is the period with the maximum wave energy.
6. Average wave period (seconds) of all waves during the 20-minute period. 
7. Mean Wave Direction (MWD) - the direction from which the waves at the dominant period (DPD) are coming. The units are degrees from true North, (North = 0 (zero) degrees and East = 90 degrees.
8. Air temperature (C) measured 3.4m above sea level.
9. Water temperature (C) measured 2m below water line.

Data is obtained from the [National Data Buoy Center](https://www.ndbc.noaa.gov/station_page.php?station=41008).
panels.title: Meterological conditions within Gray's Reef NMS

targets.query:
SELECT mean("data") FROM "bouy_wspd" 
WHERE ("data" != -999) 
AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("data") FROM "bouy_wdir" 
WHERE ("data" != -999) 
AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("data") FROM "bouy_gust" 
WHERE ("data" != -999) 
AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("data") FROM "bouy_wvht" 
WHERE ("data" != -999) 
AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("data") FROM "bouy_atemp" 
WHERE ("data" != -999) 
AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("data") FROM "bouy_wtemp" 
WHERE ("data" != -999) 
AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("data") FROM "bouy_dwpd" 
WHERE ("data" != -999) 
AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("data") FROM "bouy_awpd" 
WHERE ("data" != -999) 
AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("data") FROM "bouy_mwd" 
WHERE ("data" != -999) 
AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT /^$metric$/ FROM river_discharge
WHERE (location = '$gauge_location' AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter )
GROUP BY "location" fill(null)

panels.content:
* Satellite data is from the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS-Aqua) sensor and is obtained from the [Ocean Biology Processing Group](https://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/) at NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center.

* Algal Bloom Index (ABI) is calculated using the method of [Hu and Feng 2016](https://www.spiedigitallibrary.org/journals/journal-of-applied-remote-sensing/volume-11/issue-01/012003/Modified-MODIS-fluorescence-line-height-data-product-to-improve-image/10.1117/1.JRS.11.012003.full?SSO=1)

* River gauge height data (green cicles on map) are obtained from the [USGS National Water Information System](https://waterdata.usgs.gov/nwis).  

* Water quality data in the Savannah River comes from the [USGS National Water Information System](https://waterdata.usgs.gov/nwis/inventory?agency_code=USGS&site_no=021989773) 

* Dynamic seascapes are classified using multivariate satellite data and describe basin and gyre scale features and seasonal boundary shifts. They are obtained from [NOAA's Coastwatch](https://cwcgom.aoml.noaa.gov/erddap/griddap/noaa_aoml_seascapes_8day.graph). A description of seascape classes can be found [HERE](https://shiny.marinebon.app/seascapes/classes.html).

Please feel free to contact us with questions:

Dr. Daniel Otis - [dotis@usf.edu](mailto:dotis@usf.edu)
panels.title: Data Sources and Contact Information
